review.title: A clean well run hotel in a rather grungy area.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay here - the hotel is spotless and the staff pleasant however it might not be the best location for everyone.  Walking down the five blocks from Market is not the most pleasant experience as you have to walk by many homeless and men in wheelchairs.  I must admit that I did not feel threatened at any time however I am used to big cities and consider myself street smart. I would stay here again - hopefully when the neighborhood becomes more gentrified!
review.positiveRemarks: Spotlessly clean, comfortable bed, decent bathroom. Pleasant staff.
review.locationRemarks: Close to transit. Civic Centre is within walking distance for some amazing building and excellent museum.

review.reviewText: Nice Value.  I would come back here for the same amount of money I paid.

review.title: Good Hotel and Location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very clean and actually quiet for a busy neighborhood.
The nice lady concierge who works days was very knowledgeable 
and offered many helpful tips about sites to visit in SF.
A continental breakfast (cereal, fruit, coffee and juice) is offered, but
there is no dining room.
review.locationRemarks:
Two blocks south of the hotel is a with Peet's Coffee, Nordstrom's Rack, Bed Bath & Beyond and
a Trader Joe's and Costco.

review.title: No elevator, NOT for anyone with leg issues!
review.reviewText: Received call from site asking if we were coming. Delayed by LA and SF traffic 2.5 hours for 9 PM check in. Take their call or your room may disappear. Upon arrival, learned site is not handicap accessible. Miserable for 3 of us that shared recent injured knees, and/or knee surgery. Room on 3rd floor was nice with overlook of bar next door. Only ice machine broken for some time. Nice fridge,microwave,coffee maker. Room comfy, but narrow. Parking is poor/more narrow, and if you do not get there early each night, you must fight for street parking. Staff not up on local tourist spots, advising cable car rides were $60 to $100/ each. Pamphlet supply next to them was great/helpful. They did know where post office was though. Breakfast was okay (yogurt/prepack cereal/pastry, apple/oranges, juice bottles, and you must pick up in lobby. Few restaurants in area so bring food if coming late. Stunned that SF closes many places at 6 PM now. The  town is losing it's touch. Good hotel for those with good legs and light luggage - which we were not. Would not recommend for family with young kids.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to wharf area for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should not be "offered" as it is very limited. Needs to advertise, "We don't like handicapped folks."  Need to supply boxes for fetching food.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf, embarcadero, and other tourist sites.  Was stunned to get stuck in such heavy traffic heading to these sites.

review.reviewText: Friendly staff really helpful room was clean had fresh towels everyday and they have on-site parking which is a plus
Good and very convenient hotel. Close to all attractive place.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Comfortable.  Better than I expected for the price.

review.title: Great staff with nice touches
review.reviewText: Stayed here for several nights (one parent, two teens) on a college tour.  We mostly just come to the room to sleep and shower.  The location was convenient for public transport and seeing the sights and the free parking was ample for the rental car.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was super friendly.  There were cushy- soft towels and pleasant extras such as the Wolfgang Puck coffee and toiletries.
review.negativeRemarks: Older, dated room.
review.locationRemarks: It's the city.  Everything!  (ummm, some of it is not G or even PG rated...)

review.reviewText: Biz traveller, so hotel is near work.  Neighborhood is fair with a Trader Joes nearby, and this was handy. Staff is great and amenities provided (coffee machine, refrigerator, microwave) are not usually found at other, more 'upscale' hotels.  If you have a car, there is free parking, also unusual within SF.
It was a good hotel, friendly staff, spacious room.

review.title: Great for a business stay!
review.reviewText:
Quick check in by helpful clerk. This is a motel and while the parking area is open to the public access to the rooms area requires a key, this provided me with a greater sense of security. 
The room was clean and the decor was attractive and fresh. There was a  TV, refrigerator & blow dryer. I don't recall an alarm/clock, but I used my phone for that anyway.
No closet but there is a hanging rack with hangars. The sink area was clean and fairly modern. The toilet / shower room was clean as well and even has a window up in the ceiling to let light in. 
The motel is old, I believe 3 stories high (The lower story being parking) and is well maintained. The neighborhood was what could be expected for downtown San Francisco. A decent continental breakfast was served (and much appreciated!) That included packaged pastries, fresh fruit, small yogurt cups and refrigerated fruit juice.
Although I was not cold, my only complaint is that there is no bed spread, just sheets and blanket. Also the weather stripping could use some refreshing. I was there for 1 night on business, slept well, ate nearby and was just a mile or so from Moscone Center so the cab ride was quick or I could have walked of I wanted.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Biz traveller that has stayed at more 'upscale(?)' hotels in the area and they don't provide the amenities this place does. Coffee machine, microwave, refrigerator.  Very handy when your travel in each month for a week.   Wish I had found this place 10months ago!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is very attentive, helpful and friendly, as others have mentioned.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be updated, but a non-issue.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great for me as I walk to work and back.  Neighborhood is fine with a Trader Joe's within walking distance.

review.title: Very quiet, simple, and pleasant.
review.reviewText: Modest, simple type of setting. Good location. You'll have to walk a ways to find good restaurants. The cleaning crew kind of wait very late before cleaning room around early afternoon. I like the quiet setting, good accommodations and amenities.

review.title: Not too bad after all
review.reviewText:
You get what you pay for !!!! Pretty nice hotel with free parking lots small one , first come first serve but we didn't have to park outside in 3 nights !!!! Staff members are friendly but some of house keeper they keep chatting while they are working just outside my room !!!! So the noises of traffic , construction nearby , and staff chatting is a little bit annoying , nice and clean bathroom but the floor need an upgrade !!!!
I'll think about stay here next time in SF

review.title: Nice, cozy hotel and it had a lot of nearby places
review.reviewText: Will definitely be coming back to this place! Loved that it was walking distance to a lot of things!!! It was cute, well cleaned hotel!

review.title: Great place to stay if you're not picky
review.reviewText: I was in town for only the one night and it was close to all the places I wanted to go. There's a bus stop to the Exploratorium a block and a half away and it's 5 minutes walking distance to Trader Joe's, FYI. There is no elevator, there's 15 stair steps up to the room, but if you're planning on walking around SF all day anyway, what's a few more steps? The stairway is secure (room key needed). The parking lot is not secure. There is limited parking (a dozen spaces?) and it's first come, first served, so get there early (it's free!). The room was old, but very clean. More amenities than I expected (iron, ironing board, hair dryer, hangers, suitcase stand, outlets in the nightstand lamps' bases). The A/C is very loud, but I didn't use it while sleeping so it didn't matter. The traffic noise was barely noticeable even though all the rooms are close to the street. Free continental breakfast (6:00 - 10:00 AM) was pre-packaged danishes, instant oatmeal, dry cereal, fruit, milk, apple juice, orange juice, tea, and coffee. You'll need to bring it back to your room because it's just in the front desk area (there's no lobby). I interacted with 3 different staff persons on the phone and in person and all of them were friendly. Would definitely stay there again for what I got for the price I paid.
review.positiveRemarks: Inexpensive. Clean room. Friendly staff. Free parking and continental breakfast. Secure stairway. 11:00 AM check-out and 3:00 PM check-in times.
review.negativeRemarks: More parking spaces. Expanded breakfast selection.
review.locationRemarks: 1.5 blocks away from bus stop to Exploratorium (only $2.25 one way!). It is 2.5 miles away.

review.title: Great Place if you Planning on Visiting DNA lounge
review.reviewText: I missed the parking structure to turn into. It was hidden since there was alot of construction and traffic. Staff was really friendly. Walking distance to some clubs, markets, restaurants. Easy access to freeway.

review.title: Good enough if you are for a short time.
review.reviewText:
Rooms are confortable. but the rooms are located in a first and second floor without elevator. 
The neighborhood is scary.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel that was close to AT&T park. Front desk staff was so friendly and helpful. For the price we will stay again. The only problem is hotel parking, not enough spaces for hotel guest if it's full. You have to find street parking, which made us nervous.

review.title: SF Disappointment
review.reviewText:
We had a good experience with the front counter lady the first day as she was very helpful and even was able to fix the TV which did not receive all the standard channels. She was very nice but the lady there on check out was not pleasant at all,

Also this may have been the smallest room we ever stayed in so we are glad we did not have more luggage. 

Overall a rather disappointing experience

review.title: Nice discount motel for stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We spent 2 nights in San Francisco and were on a budget. We needed a cheap motel that was not a dump or in a dangerous area of town. This motel was suitable. 

It has pros and cons. 
The motel is about 5-6 blocks from Market Street where you can catch metro (BART,) bus & street cars (which will take you to Fisherman's Wharf), so plan to walk. No shuttle was available, so we walked to the BART station 6 blocks away to travel to the airport.
There is no elevator, so it is not handicapped accessible. The rooms are all on the 2nd and 3rd floors and you need a room card to access the stairs, which provides security. Parking is on the ground level, but we didn't drive in so we did not need to use it.
Near Hwy 101, so it's pretty noisy at night if you are a light sleeper. It didn't bother me but it kept my son awake.
Breakfast is provided, but includes mostly carbs and little protein, so diabetics need to eat elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: In-room coffee maker, small refrigerator and microwave in room. Amenities also include blow dryer and iron with stand. Free wifi.
review.locationRemarks: This motel is about 5-6 blocks south of Market. There is nothing to do nearby, but public transport is available on Market St.

review.title: San Francisco Inn
review.reviewText: Parking is slim.  Stairs are very difficult for older adults.  There should be rails on both sides of the stairs.  Lost money on the soda machine.
review.positiveRemarks: It was quiet for my room.
review.negativeRemarks: 1. Rails on both sides of the stairs.  2. Too hard for older adults.  Need an elevator.
review.locationRemarks: We went to the AT&T stadium.

review.title: Economy
review.reviewText: The room cleanliness was disappointing (haphazard vacuuming, items left in the minifridge.  It's also in a sketchy part of town.
review.positiveRemarks: Economy
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness

review.title: Surprisingly  Pleasant
review.reviewText: I was in San Fran for Pride, my original booking for another place fell through, then I found this place and very glad I did. The staff was absolutely nice. There was a bar on the corner, and I was within walking distance of the parade and pretty much close to anything I wanted to go to.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to a lot of things, great location. Would definitely book again.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary water in the fridge on arrival would have been nice
review.locationRemarks: Close to bars, and the mall. Restaurants, transit, you name it you'll be near or a short distance away.

review.title: Close to town but disappointing
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights and were promised connecting rooms, but we had instead 2 rooms next door to each other.  With our 12-year old grandson, this was not comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to town.
review.negativeRemarks: It is cramped and noisy.
review.locationRemarks: It is off of the main st. (Market). but an industrial neighborhood.

review.title: Great for what we needed
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel because of the location and most importantly, because of free parking! The only negative part of our stay was the fact that we didn't realize parking is on a first come, first serve basis. We had a late check in the first night so unfortunately, there were no spaces available when we arrived. The hotel staff informed us that street parking is only paid from 9am-6pm so we managed to park just outside the hotel overnight. Luckily, the next day we were able to move over to the garage when one of the other guests left.

Otherwise, the room is clean and includes everything you need for your stay (even a coffee maker and microwave!). Breakfast was good and the neighborhood was within walking distance to many cool parts of town.
Only 1/2 mile from transportation to anywhere! Great for a short stay.

review.title: Great hotel close to transportation.
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at the San Francisco Inn. It was so easy to get around and the staff were all helpful in getting needed information. The room was kept very clean by the friendly staff. I would stay there again in a heart beat.
review.positiveRemarks: As I said, it is near to transportation and had a wonderful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't think that there is much else that is needed.
review.locationRemarks: The location is South Of Market and there were many clubs nearby.

review.title: Great value hotel
review.reviewText: Great place to stay when using hotel for bed and bathroom. Can't beat free parking in SF but it is limited. Rooms are very small but it was expected from other reviews.
Location was excellent. Room  was clear. The staff was very helpful.

review.title: S.F. Giants Game
review.reviewText: I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel.  Able to walk to the stadium but get a taxi back. I don't recommend walking back in the dark.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and offers a continental breakfast.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Carpet floor was wet. You could see through the cracks in the door. Dirty area. Very small room
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing. Cancelled remainder of nights.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Too far from everything

review.title: Interesting area...
review.reviewText: Decent hotel but the area is not for everyone's liking as there are many homeless and drug addicts/dealers in this area.

review.title: Exactly what we were after
review.reviewText: A walking distance to Bart station, clean room, helpful staff and safe area in SOMA. Would stay here again If I need a place to stay in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, near public transportation, clean, comfy bed.
review.negativeRemarks: There was some noise from a drunk out on the street that was fairly loud but this is not the hotels fault.
review.locationRemarks: We went to a concert at Slim's 2 blocks away was a very easy walk.

review.title: tiny and old hotel located in bad area
review.reviewText: There was no eating space for breakfast.  The beds are very old and not good condition.  Very noisy during night.  Room was small and no extra space for sitting.  There were under construction buildings around the hotel.  The hotel building is not well maintained and dirty. I god bad memory about the hotel.

review.title: NO PARKING ENOUGH TO accommodate ALL guests
review.reviewText: not emiugh parking,,no elevator,only staff was very helpful..

review.title: Outstanding value, good (enough) accommodations
review.reviewText:
Location was excellent, within a 10-15 minute walk from the Civic Center BART station, and 20-30 minute walk to Mission. Considering this, and that the price was about half of the average for hotels in the city, and that the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful made for an excellent value. I only stayed one night, but found the room to be very clean, though rather dated (CRT TV, old but functional iron, e.g.). 

The bed was reasonably comfortable but nothing to write home about. Worked well regardless and I woke up without any kinks in my back or neck. 

Wifi worked just fine and was reasonably fast (though I didn't do anything to really stresstest it aside from some streaming videos).

One interesting note, it was the first hotel room in recent memory where the bathroom had a proper ventilation fan; a small luxury but one that for some reason has always struck me as odd for being absent even in high end accommodations.

The front desk staff was quick to get me checked in, friendly, and offered a number of suggestions for both food and local distractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, location, good-enough accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: Some renovations would perk the place up a bit including new carpet and perhaps mattresses, eventually swap the TV for current millennium technology.

review.reviewText: location is a bit out of the way but not too inconvenient. excellent hotel for the price.\

review.title: My experience
review.reviewText:
It was a little room but it was clean and the staff was always very attentive.  It was not so far from places of interest.  It takes you 5-10 minutes to go to Union Square on vehicle and around 10-15 minutes to arrive on Fisherman's Wharf.  

The only this that I dislike was that there are many doves in the hotel and sometimes the floor of the entry of the room was dirty.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the staff, the location and that it was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Please, try to get rid of the doves.

review.title: Thanksgiving Holiday
review.reviewText: This location is great if you are not from San Francisco and you don't know your way around town. It is right off the freeway and over all a good place to stay at.

Unfortunately the accommodations were not great.  This is the first time I have actually left a hotel without staying the night.  We opted to drive back home after dinner instead of staying the night.

review.title: Scary!!!
review.reviewText: Heart of the Tenderloin district. Listened to bum wars all night. Our view was of a shanty town. Didn't feel safe at all
A great location.  Old hotel but clean...great staff...comfortable bed...free parking was nice.

This hotel is relatively affordable and near downtown, and thus was a good place for me to stay during a week-long conference. I was surprised at the number of homeless people on the streets nearby, but the area did not feel unsafe.  The staff were very pleasant and the room was reasonably nice, including nice granite counters in the bathroom (although having two chairs in a room that sleeps two people would be good), and the other amenities were fine.  The only problem was that one of the six nights of my stay, there was a very rowdy bunch of youth staying in the hotel, shouting across the courtyard (including obscenities) and slamming their doors all night long.  I started to think they were doing some kind of illicit business from their rooms, and I did not feel safe that night.  I was surprised that the hotel just thought "they were acting like kids" and didn't kick them out of the place, given how disruptive this gang of kids was to anyone else trying to sleep or feel at ease staying there.  So, I think the management needs to be  more assertive and customer-supportive in responding to incidents like this, even if they are rare, but otherwise my stay was reasonably comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: About 1/2 mile from the UN/Civic Center BART station, and a mile and a quarter from the Moscone Center.

review.title: Decent Affordable hotel
review.reviewText: The lamp on one side of the  bed wasn't working and when I investigated, I figured out the outlet wasn't working (my laptop wouldn't charge from either outlet). The breakfast is packaged honeybun type things. Otherwise, ok. No elevator.
review.positiveRemarks: affordable
review.negativeRemarks: parking, elevator
review.locationRemarks: next door to a drag show!

review.title: Clean, friendly. No problems.
review.reviewText: It was a nice place to stay. Not particularly fancy, but very comfortable. The wifi worked really well at all times. The TV was the same. The bathroom was a little older, but there were no problems.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff. Clean. Wifi and TV worked well.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom could be renovated, and it is located a few blocks from Market Street and further from downtown. No problem provided you are happy to walk.

review.title: Decent place
review.reviewText: Neighborhood seems a bit dicey at first, but you get used to it when you realize that's just SF. Room clean and everything worked. Staff very friendly and helpful. Reasonable access to public transportation.  I'd stay here again.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: It was good value for the location , plus it was holiday weekend

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Good value. It could use tighter seals on the doors for soundproofing.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: I found the front desk staff to be not very approachable. Could improve. Breakfast not very nice at all. Cereal or pre-packaged pastries. Have to eat in your room. Starbucks two blocks away. Rooms ok. Happy with security. Free parking and wifi sold me. Microwave and fridge handy. Happy with location except for homeless but soon came to realise that they are all over town (wherever you wander).

review.title: Ok hotel in a not so great neighborhood
review.reviewText: Comfortable room but there are plenty of homless in that area

review.title: Ideally located
review.reviewText: We found this hotel immediately upon arrival in the city. Free parking was included. We were also ideally located to use public transportation, and the staff was very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: It was easy to locate.
review.negativeRemarks: The room could have used more blankets. Only one thin blanket was provided and no bedspread.
review.locationRemarks: 1/2 mile from Market St, where we were able to get food @ any hr, or see a movie

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for the convenience of location closest to my dr.'s appointment. We were pleasantly surprised at how clean it was. The staff was very friendly. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and will likely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the staff and the room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The Wi Fi connection wasn't working.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to some really good places to eat. Close to shopping and scenic views.

review.title: It was great location for me
review.reviewText: Would stay here again my friend works very close by so it was nice to be able to spend time with him

review.title: Nice Hotel, close and convenient to Mission Bay
review.reviewText: Stayed one night for an appointment to UCSF medical clinics at Mission Bay, Close to Civic center, easy drive to Mission Bay facilities, Quiet, clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Parking, location and very reasonable price.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Civic Center and Market Street. Easy to get to and find from Bay Bridge, I-80.

review.title: Not fancy, but clean, comfortable, and friendly
review.reviewText: We thought this little hotel was great. It wasn't new or fancy, but everything was very clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking. Free continental breakfast. Loved the sky light in the bathroom (top floor). Staff were friendly - helped us learn about transportation.

review.reviewText: For the price range this is a great place. I was just looking for something reasonable because of work in the city. From the outside it doesn't look great. Inside you can tell the owner really cares about this little place. It is clean & comfy & the staff was super friendly. Free parking is a plus but it is limited. Great value for the price...in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Expedia

review.title: A week South of Market
review.reviewText: Besides the cold damp weather it was a fun trip did all the tourist things. Went to all the bars in the area. and had a great meal for a good price at a small place called Wicket Grounds just off the corner of Folsom and 8 st. The staff at the Lone Star made us feel right at home.
review.positiveRemarks: The location it was near the bars that we wanted to drink at plus it offered on site parking with the room cost.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff could be more aware of what was around the Hotel. ie a gym a block away and places to eat near by like the food truck corner great food.
review.locationRemarks: I have all ready mentioned the gym a block south. the food truck parking lot across the street from COSCO. the leather shops near by. the gay bar sene

review.title: IT SERVED THE PURPOSE!
review.reviewText: I came for Folsom Fair and wasn't expecting much and I got it.Simple room nothing with ambaince it just served the purpose for the weekend!

review.title: so so
review.reviewText: Definitely was not worth $120/night...the room smelled of urine and cigarettes, we were right by the ice machine and soda machine and it was just kind of icky. The ice machine was also leaking (I hope it was ice) because there was a big puddle outside our room. But the staff was very friendly and accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: There's a trader joes nearby...not much else in walking distance.

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText: Nice enough. Luckily my friend was disable so they had to move a car so we could park. Not enough parkings for how many rooms they have. And it was a Tuesday night.

review.title: Consider the price.
review.reviewText: Hundred bucks. Close to concert venue. Location in the city is a little sketch. Room was fine. Water pressure in shower was not great. Overall, exactly what you will get for $100.

review.title: A bit worn out, but cheap and good staff.
review.reviewText:
While the very helpful staff and lower price (for the area) more than made up for the condition of the motel it's a particularly beaten up old building with only very basic facilities.

Rooms aren't at all soundproof and the motel is between two major roads (and there's a bus depot behind it). Windows were single pane with a very primitive lock and the door lock popped open twice while I was there. My room smelled of stale tobacco despite being a no smoking room.

The motel does have free wifi. It's a bit slow, but usually works. You also get a fridge and microwave.

Note that they don't have a lockable luggage room, so after you check out you have to take your bags with you immediately, which is a bit of a pain if your flight isn't until later in the day.
review.positiveRemarks: Very Helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Stale tobacco smell in the room
review.locationRemarks: Very run down end of SF

review.title: A Nice Hotel in SF Downtown
review.reviewText: Hotel is small. Staffs are very friendly. The building is old but room condition is ok.

review.title: "In Transition" to a better hotel
review.reviewText:
We decided to check out this hotel for a weekend in the city. It's a nice location in the heart of SoMa's nightlife, and with free parking, we didn't have to worry about the car. The afternoon employee, Jennifer, was super friendly and welcoming, and the room was really cute - not huge, but perfect for a weekend away. Clean, free wifi, decent sized bathroom, and a fridge.

Things got a little dicey the next morning, however. After not sleeping great, I phoned the front desk to ask for more pillows and another blanket, and figured I'd get some extra towels as well. The day manager gave me the fifth degree about the request, including some confusion about whether I wanted the amenities delivered immediately or done when housekeeping came to clean. Eventually everything arrived, but when I traded in my dirty towels I was told I'd be charged ($10!) for a soiled washcloth. If I had known there was a charge for getting the linens dirty, I'd have brought my own! We later worked it out and ultimately weren't charged, but were told that since the hotel is "in transition" they are very low on linens. There also was construction going on - including on Sunday morning - that was more than a little annoying.

Overall, I'm an optimist, so I'd recommend this location with a "5 star" rating with the hope that the customer service snafus will be remedied once the "transition" is over.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, afternoon staff, room comfort and cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Day manager - was nice the second day, but this could be more consistent. She also seemed very condescending/mean to the cleaning staff.
review.locationRemarks: Great SoMa location that is very close to bars and concert venues (both gay and straight). With free parking, also easy to drive elsewhere.

review.title: its impossible to beat in SF
review.reviewText: Recently changed ownership (4 months ago). For the price, its impossible to beat in SF. Better than AirBnB and better then hotels 2x 3x the price. Great value.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Its a vagabond inn. it is what it is. Its not the ace hotel but you pay for that...
review.locationRemarks: Not the fanciest area but close to the new hip areas. For me, it was perfect. Tourists may not like this as much.

review.title: just a low end motel
review.reviewText: just a low end motel. The sheet was clean, the comforter was thin and old and not warm enough for me. The hotel staff was courteous.

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: Staff was great, the room does need better attention to detail! Dirty sink, hair in tub and in the bed! Refrigerator was leaking, phone didn't work. But over all it worked for what we need it for.
